sydney.title: Sydney, NSW
sydney.description: We happened to arrive in Sydney on Australia Day (Jan 26), also seemingly the hottest day of the year.

images.caption: Defying the heat, we made a pit stop at the beautiful Royal Botanic Garden.
Hustle and bustle in the CBD.
The next day, we went on a tour in Blue Mountain, seeing magnificant cliffs and waterfalls.
Checked out Darling Harbour. Coming from NYC, it was just amazing how spacious and clean public spaces were. There're bathrooms and water fountains everywhere we went.
Checked out Darling Harbour. Coming from NYC, it was just amazing how spacious and clean public spaces were. There're bathrooms and water fountains everywhere we went.
Went to see La Boheme at Sydney Opera House. It was a perfect cool evening that ended with pizza at a dive bar.
So much good brunch and Asian food here. Vietnamese was a must!
Ventured out to Bondi beach on an overcast day. Icebergs was the sleekest infinity pool perched on the side of the cliff. It was as icy as the name suggested.
The last day was spent at Taronga Zoo. So many animals from all the continents - so impressive! And, of course, kangaroos for days.

brisbane.title: Brisbane, Queensland
brisbane.description: Bidded farewell to my parents, we were off to gloriously sunny Brisbane.

images.caption: Photogenic Story Bridge and a breezy stroll on the riverside.
Eagle Street Pier was vibing.
Many cute cafes in the CBD.
Lovely afternoon in South Bank.
I loved walking around Queen Street Mall and vintage shopping in Paddington.
We really enjoyed the healthy organic brunch at Lokal + Co in West End.

melbourne.title: Melbourne, Victoria
melbourne.description: We were shocked by the 30-degree drop in temperature once we landed in Melbourne. Definitely didn't pack for this.

images.caption: We stayed in Docklands, which was connected to the CBD by a free tram.
Lovely exhibits at National Gallery of Victoria.
Gritty graffiti at Hosier Lane.
Melbourne by night, shining down on the Yarra River.
Coop's Shot Tower in Melbourne Central and St Paul's Cathedral.
The magnificient interior of State Library Victoria.
